concept.definition:
[PR] Irregular in shape
A mass that can't be characterized by any specific shape. 
[Bi-Rads® Atlas — Mammography Fifth Ed. 2013]
The shape is neither round nor oval.For mammography, use of this descriptor usually implies a suspicious finding.
Valid for the following modalities: MG US MRI.

[PR] Lobulated in shape
A mass that has an undulating  (having a smoothly rising and falling form or outline) contour. 
Valid for the following modalities: MG US MRI.

[PR] Oval in shape
A mass that is elliptical or egg-shaped. 
[Bi-Rads® Atlas — Mammography Fifth Ed. 2013]
Shape is elliptical or egg-shaped (may include 2 or 3 undulations, , i.e., "gently lobulated" or "macrolobulated").
Valid for the following modalities: MG US MRI.

[PR] Reniform

[Bi-Rads® Atlas — Mammography Fifth Ed. 2013]
is a three-dimensional lesion that occupies a space within the breast.
Valid for the following modalities: MG.

[PR] Round in shape
A mass that is spherical, ball-shaped, circular or global. 
[Bi-Rads® Atlas — Mammography Fifth Ed. 2013]
A mass that is spherical, ball-shaped, circular, or globular in shape.A round mass has an anteroposterior diameter equal to its transverse diameterand to qualify as a ROUND mass, it must be circular in perpendicular projections.Breast masses with a ROUND shape are not commonly seen with breast ultrasound.
Valid for the following modalities: MG US MRI.
